article.headline: Robert Morris 69, Cent. Connecticut St. 60
article.story: NEW BRITAIN, Conn. -- Karon Abraham scored 16 points and Rob Robinson added 14 points to lead Robert Morris to a 69-60 victory over Central Connecticut State on Thursday night. Robert Morris (17-9, 12-1 Northeast Conference) opened the second half on a 12-4 run to pull away from Central Connecticut State (9-15, 6-7), which had won four straight. The Colonials took advantage of two scoring droughts for its 10th win in its past 11 games. The Blue Devils went without a field goal for 9:30 in the first half as a two-point lead turned into a 12-point deficit. In the second half, the Blue Devils went scoreless for nearly 7 minutes as Robert Morris built a 55-38 lead. The Colonials shot 58.3 percent from the field (14-for-24) in the first half and finished at 50 percent (26 of 52). Shemik Thompson scored 16 points and Markeys Deans and Joe Efese added 14 points each for the Blue Devils.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
